title: 12-year-old shot by 2-year-old in driveway of home
content:
A 12-year-old has been released from the hospital on Sunday night after being shot by a 2-year-old relative earlier in the day.
The shooting happened Sunday morning in Hermitage on Blue Hills Drive.
This shooting is the 26th unintentional shooting in Tennessee this year involving a child.
Fortunately, the 12-year-old who was shot in the leg is going to be OK, but the same can't be said for seven other children this year.
"I hear these kids just screaming bloody murder, " said Robert Dubose, who lives next door.
He said there were six kids in the driveway when the shooting happened.
"Then I realized there was a gentleman about 12 years old sitting on the ground holding his leg screaming," said Dubose.
Police said the gun owner was visiting her sister and had a loaded gun in the side compartment of her car.
Somehow the 2-year-old who lived at the house got a hold of the pistol and shot the 12-year-old.
"We believe these incidents are not accidents. We believe they are preventable tragedies," said Beth Joslin Roth of Safe Tennessee Project.
Roth is working to bring awareness to this type of gun violence.
On Sunday night at Exit-In in Nashville she put together a concert series, one of many taking place nationwide.
"There are concerts happening all the way from Maine to Hawaii in 350 venues across the nation," said Roth.
All of the concerts are to raise awareness and help people to get involved in gun violence prevention.
In this weekend's shooting, police said the gun owner was legally allowed to have her firearm in her car.
However, she does not have a carry permit.
As of Sunday night no charges have been filed in this case.
